DataElement.preferredName: No Primary Surgical Procedure Performed Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information for the reason a primary diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue would not have occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to primary surgery performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Executed and carried through to completion. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Information for the reason a primary diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue would not have occurred.

PermissibleValues.value: Provider treatment preference (neo-adjuvant chemo vs. primary cytoreduction)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One that makes something available.: The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.

Concepts.definition: The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Decision made by clinical trial subject

Unable to be removed with surgery.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Not capable of being removed by surgery.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
